mojo.description: Parses ANTLR 4 grammar files *.g4 and transforms them into Java source files.

parameter.name: arguments
parameter.description: A list of additional command line arguments to pass to the ANTLR tool.

parameter.name: atn
parameter.description: If set to true then the ANTLR tool will generate a description of the ATN for each rule in Dot format.

parameter.name: excludes
parameter.description: A set of Ant-like exclusion patterns used to prevent certain files from being processed. By default, this set is empty such that no files are excluded.

parameter.name: forceATN
parameter.description: Use the ATN simulator for all predictions.

parameter.name: generateTestSources
parameter.description: Specifies whether sources are added to the compile or test scope.

parameter.name: includes
parameter.description: Provides an explicit list of all the grammars that should be included in the generate phase of the plugin. Note that the plugin is smart enough to realize that imported grammars should be included but not acted upon directly by the ANTLR Tool. A set of Ant-like inclusion patterns used to select files from the source directory for processing. By default, the pattern **/*.g4 is used to select grammar files.

parameter.name: inputEncoding
parameter.description: specify grammar file encoding; e.g., euc-jp

parameter.name: libDirectory
parameter.description: Specify location of imported grammars and tokens files.

parameter.name: listener
parameter.description: Generate parse tree listener interface and base class.

parameter.name: options
parameter.description: A list of grammar options to explicitly specify to the tool. These options are passed to the tool using the -D<option>=<value> syntax.

parameter.name: outputDirectory
parameter.description: Specify output directory where the Java files are generated.

parameter.name: outputEncoding
parameter.description: specify output file encoding; defaults to source encoding

parameter.name: sourceDirectory
parameter.description: The directory where the ANTLR grammar files (*.g4) are located.

parameter.name: visitor
parameter.description: Generate parse tree visitor interface and base class.
